alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Misty Fjords; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 08 at 5:08PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, southern Inner Channels, the southeast Gulf Coast and portions of the eastern Gulf Coast. This includes the cities of Sitka, Port Alexander, Craig, Klawock, Ketchikan, Metlakatla, And Hyder. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. Soils remain moist and excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Mariners should be aware of their vessels filling with water and sinking if moored and should take action to remove excess water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate to heavy rainfall has already begun across the region with 24-hour rainfall totals ending Tuesday afternoon ranging from 1 to 2 inches with locally higher amounts. An additional 2 to 3 inches of rain are expected between Tuesday evening and Wednesday evening.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Do not enter or cross flowing water or water of unknown depth. Persons living along streams should stay alert and be prepared to take action if a warning or advisory is issued, or flooding is observed.
